intro: Odontadenia, commonly known as the toothed lily, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Iridaceae. It is native to South Africa and comprises several species, most of which are characterized by their striking, showy flowers. The plants typically have narrow, grass-like leaves and produce flowers in shades of white, yellow, and orange. Odontadenia species are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
